Description: Rough red ware pottery figure-mould, rectangular, for the production of relief figures of Osiris.
Curator's comments: Several similar finds were discovered in the Theban area and are likely to come from the Valley of the Monkeys, near the Valley of the Kings, where numerous mummiform figures placed in pottery coffins and cornmummies of Osiris were deposited. For a very similar 'Osiris brick', said to be from Thebes: see Ashmolean Museum, Oxford 1991.18 (Goddio, F. and Masson-Berghoff, A. 2016, Sunken Cities: Egypt Lost Worlds, Catalogue for the British Museum exhibition (19 May-27 November), London, 170). For an interpretation of the 'Osiris bricks': Tooley, A. M. J. 1996, ‘Osiris bricks’, Journal of Egyptian Archaeology 82, 167–179.
